name: Rich and Creamy Potatoes Au Gratin
author: Celeste
summary: These are the easiest, creamiest potatoes au gratin I have ever had... YUM!
ingredients: 3 pounds Yukon Gold potatoes, peeled and very thinly sliced
freshly ground black pepper to taste
2 cups freshly shredded Gruyere cheese, divided
directions: Preheat oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C)
Place potatoes, garlic, and salt into a large pot, fill with enough water to cover, and bring to a boil
Reduce heat to medium, and simmer the potatoes until tender but not mushy, 8 to 10 minutes
With a slotted spoon, transfer about half the potatoes to a 9x13-inch baking dish
Pour half of the cream over the potatoes, season with black pepper and nutmeg, and sprinkle half of the Gruyere cheese onto the mixture
Top with the remaining potatoes; sprinkle again with black pepper and nutmeg
Pour on the remaining cream, and sprinkle with remaining Gruyere cheese
Bake in the preheated oven until the cheese topping is crisp and brown on top, about 1 hour
